plantuml_diagram:
@startuml
!define AWSPuml https://raw.githubusercontent.com/awslabs/aws-icons-for-plantuml/v20.0/dist
!include AWSPuml/AWSCommon.puml

skinparam shadowing false
skinparam componentStyle rectangle
skinparam wrapWidth 220
skinparam maxMessageSize 120

title Static Web App on Kubernetes (Nginx) with CI/CD

actor "End User" as user
cloud "Internet" as internet

node "AWS Cloud" as aws {
  node "Amazon EKS Cluster" as eks {
    node "Kubernetes Namespace" as ns {
      node "Deployment: btry-indi\nReplicas: 3-6" as deploy {
        artifact "Nginx Container\nStatic HTML/CSS/JS" as nginx
      }
      node "Service: LoadBalancer\n(ALB annotations)" as svc
    }
  }
  node "AWS Application Load Balancer (ALB)" as alb
}

cloud "External CDNs" as cdn {
  component "Font Awesome (cdnjs)" as fa
  component "Google Fonts" as gf
}

node "Container Registries" as reg {
  component "Docker Hub\nyash5090/btry-indi:latest" as dh
  component "GitHub Container Registry (GHCR)" as ghcr
}

node "CI/CD" as cicd {
  component "GitHub Actions\nBuild/Push/Sign" as gha
  component "Jenkins Pipeline\nBuild/Test/Scan/Deploy" as jenkins
  component "SonarQube" as sonar
  component "OWASP Dependency-Check" as owasp
  component "Trivy / Docker Scout" as trivy
  component "kubectl" as kubectl
  component "Terraform (optional)" as tf
}

user --> internet
internet --> alb : HTTPS
alb --> svc : forwards
svc --> deploy : routes
nginx --> fa : load CSS
nginx --> gf : load fonts

gha --> ghcr : push image
jenkins --> dh : push/pull image
jenkins --> sonar : code quality
jenkins --> owasp : dependency scan
jenkins --> trivy : image scan
jenkins --> kubectl : apply manifests\n(Deployment/Service)
jenkins --> tf : provision infra (implied)

ghcr --> deploy : pull image
dh --> deploy : pull image

@enduml

architecture_description:
## High-level architecture

### Runtime / Serving path
- **Static Web Application**: A front-end only UI (HTML/CSS/JavaScript) packaged into an **Nginx container** (via Dockerfile) and deployed to Kubernetes.
- **Kubernetes (Amazon EKS implied)**:
  - **Deployment**: `btry-indi` with **multiple replicas (3–6)** for availability and horizontal scaling.
  - **Service (type LoadBalancer)**: Exposes the Deployment externally.
- **External Load Balancer (AWS ALB implied)**: The Kubernetes Service includes AWS ALB-related annotations, implying traffic enters through an **AWS Application Load Balancer** and is forwarded to the Service/Pods.
- **External CDN dependencies**: The served HTML references third-party assets:
  - **Font Awesome** from cdnjs
  - **Google Fonts** from fonts.googleapis.com

### Build, release, and deployment (CI/CD)
- **GitHub Actions**: Workflows build the container image and publish it to **GitHub Container Registry (GHCR)** (including signing).
- **Jenkins Pipeline**: Automates build/test/scan/deploy steps and integrates security/quality tooling:
  - **SonarQube** for code quality
  - **OWASP Dependency-Check** for dependency scanning (even though no package manager is detected, it’s referenced by pipeline)
  - **Trivy / Docker Scout** for container image scanning
  - **kubectl** to apply Kubernetes manifests (Deployment/Service)
  - **Terraform (optional/implied)** referenced for infrastructure provisioning, but no `.tf` sources were found in the repo (only logs), so it’s shown as an implied capability.

### Key relationships
- Users access the app over **HTTPS** via the **ALB**, which forwards to the Kubernetes **Service**, which routes to the **Deployment/Pods**.
- The running web app loads styling/fonts from **external CDNs**.
- CI systems publish images to **registries (Docker Hub and/or GHCR)**; Kubernetes pulls images from these registries during deployment/rollout.
